projects.description: In response to the global COVID-19 pandemic, I developed MaskGuard, a deep learning-based system designed to automatically detect whether individuals are wearing face masks in real-time. Leveraging Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), the model achieves 91% accuracy in classifying images as "with mask" or "without mask." The system is trained on a dataset of 7,553 images and is optimized for robustness and scalability. This project highlights the potential of AI in promoting public health safety and compliance.
projects.title: MaskGuard - AI-Powered Face Mask Detection System

member.occupation: AI Engineer | Expert in Machine Learning, Deep Learning & AI Solutions | Python | TensorFlow | NLP | Computer Vision | Driving Innovation with Cutting-Edge AI Technologies

projects.description:
This project focuses on analyzing and forecasting time series data for both seasonal and non-seasonal datasets. The non-seasonal analysis involves forecasting Brent crude oil prices, which are critical for economic forecasting, investment decisions, and policy formulation. The seasonal analysis examines the Industrial Production Index (IPN31152N), which reflects monthly changes in industrial production over several decades. The project employs advanced statistical methods, including ARIMA and SARIMA models, to identify trends, seasonality, and patterns in the data. The goal is to provide accurate forecasts that can assist stakeholders in making informed decisions in energy markets and industrial production planning.
Key components of the project include:

Data Preprocessing: Handling missing values, outliers, and ensuring data stationarity.

Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA): Visualizing trends, seasonality, and distribution patterns using line plots, boxplots, and heatmaps.

Modeling: Applying ARIMA and SARIMA models to forecast future values.

Model Validation: Using residual diagnostics, Ljung-Box tests, and accuracy metrics (MAE, RMSE, AIC, BIC) to evaluate model performance.

Forecasting: Generating forecasts for future time periods and analyzing their implications for decision-making.
projects.title: Time Series Analysis and Forecasting: Seasonal and Non-Seasonal Patterns in Industrial Production and Oil Prices

member.occupation: AI Engineer | Expert in Machine Learning, Deep Learning & AI Solutions | Python | TensorFlow | NLP | Computer Vision | Driving Innovation with Cutting-Edge AI Technologies

projects.description:
This project involves web scraping movie data from Rotten Tomatoes and performing predictive analysis to classify audience scores as positive or negative. The goal is to understand the factors influencing audience ratings and build a machine learning model to predict whether a movie will be well-received by audiences. The project is divided into two main parts:

Web Scraping:

Scraped movie data (title, URL, critic score, audience score, and streaming date) from Rotten Tomatoes using Python libraries like requests and BeautifulSoup.

Collected data for over 5,500 movies across multiple pages.

Saved the scraped data into a CSV file for further analysis.

Predictive Analysis:

Preprocessed the data by handling missing values and encoding categorical variables.

Created a binary target variable (audience_score_binary) to classify movies as "positive" (audience score ≥ 50) or "negative" (audience score < 50).

Built and evaluated a Logistic Regression model to predict audience sentiment.

Analyzed model performance using metrics like accuracy, precision, recall, F1 score, and confusion matrix.
projects.title: Web Scraping and Predictive Analysis of Movie Ratings Using Rotten Tomatoes Data

member.occupation: AI Engineer | Expert in Machine Learning, Deep Learning & AI Solutions | Python | TensorFlow | NLP | Computer Vision | Driving Innovation with Cutting-Edge AI Technologies

projects.description:
This project focuses on predicting house prices using advanced machine learning techniques. The real estate market is a dynamic and complex system influenced by various factors such as property attributes, location, and economic indicators. To enhance the accuracy and efficiency of real estate valuation, this study employs machine learning algorithms, including Linear Regression, Random Forest, and XGBoost, to build predictive models.

The dataset used in this project includes features such as square footage, number of bedrooms, neighborhood attributes, and economic indicators. The methodology involves data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation using metrics like Mean Absolute Error (MAE), Mean Squared Error (MSE), Root Mean Squared Error (RMSE), and R-squared. The results demonstrate that XGBoost outperforms the other models, achieving the highest accuracy and robustness in predicting house prices. This project provides valuable insights for homeowners, real estate professionals, and investors, enabling them to make informed decisions in the housing market.
projects.title: "Machine Learning-Based House Price Prediction: A Comparative Analysis of Regression Models"

member.occupation: AI Engineer | Expert in Machine Learning, Deep Learning & AI Solutions | Python | TensorFlow | NLP | Computer Vision | Driving Innovation with Cutting-Edge AI Technologies

projects.description:
In the ever-evolving landscape of healthcare, where costs have soared due to the complexities of the modern healthcare system, the power of data has emerged as a beacon of hope. Healthcare analytics, much like a skilled navigator, holds the key to understanding and transforming the intricate web of health insurance costs. This is the mission of our project: to harness the transformative potential of data.
Our journey begins with the realization that health insurance costs have reached unprecedented levels. This escalation is a result of numerous factors, including the rising cost of healthcare services and an array of individual characteristics. It's a multifaceted puzzle that calls for a comprehensive solution.We embark on this mission with the heart of a data virtuoso. Armed with the latest tools and techniques in healthcare analytics, we delve into a vast dataset, comprising variables such as age, sex, BMI, number of children, smoking habits, and region. Like a sculptor chiseling away at a block of marble, we meticulously dissect and interpret this data, applying both quantitative and qualitative methods to reveal the hidden insights and patterns within.At the core of our analysis lies the prediction of medical costs – a crucial indicator that unlocks a world of possibilities. This prediction empowers individuals, healthcare providers, and insurers to make informed decisions. It guides patients toward better planning, assists healthcare professionals in optimizing treatment plans, and helps insurance providers in setting fair premiums.Collaboration is at the heart of our endeavor. We work closely with experts in the field, building a bridge between the world of data and the world of healthcare. The insights we generate through data analysis become the guiding stars, steering our stakeholders towards better decision-making. With compelling data visualizations, we breathe life into these insights, making them accessible and actionable.
projects.title: estimating healthcare insurance expenses through Machine learning
